newsitem.title: UK: STV down as chairman cashes in options.
newsitem.headline: STV down as chairman cashes in options.

text.p: Shares in Scottish Television Plc dropped on Thursday after the company said chairman Angus Macdonald and director Alistair Moffat had cashed in share options yesterday.
The stock was quoted down 17-1/2p at 706-1/2 by 0950 GMT though no trades were recorded in the stock.
STV said Macdonald had made a net 200,000 profit after he exercised options in respect of 231,400 shares at an aggregate subscription price of 235.6p and then sold 150,000 of those shares at 720.6p.
Moffat exercised options over 44,200 shares at an aggregate subscription price of 414.9p and subsequently sold at 720p, giving net proceeds of 80,000 stg, STV said.
